It must have a high a specific heat capacity
it must expand and contrast uniformly and steady

questions.question: Convert 57<sup>o</sup>F to <sup>o</sup>C

questions.question: The study of heat mearsurement is _____ ?
The amount of heat required to raise the temperature of a substance by one Kelvin is ____ ?

How much heat is needed to bring 10g of water from 50<sup>o</sup> to boiling point _____ ?
To a 1Kg sample of wood 40KJ of heat is added. Its temperature is found to rise from 20<sup>o</sup>C to 40<sup>o</sup>C. What is the specific heat capacity of the wood__?

A relative density bottle of 50cm<sup>3</sup> is completely filled with a liquid at 30<sup>o</sup>C its then heated to 80<sup>o</sup>C such that 0.75cm<sup>2</sup> of liquid is expelled. Calculate the apparent cubic expansivity of the liquid?

A piece of copper 0.1Kg is heated to 100<sup>o</sup>C and then transferred to a well lagged copper can of mass 0.05Kg containing 0.2Kg of water at 10<sup>o</sup>C. Calculate the final temperature of the mixture ?

A piece of iron mass 0.2Kg is heated to 64<sup>o</sup>C and gently drop into 0.15kg of water at 16<sup>o</sup>CC. if the temperature of the mixture is 22<sup>o</sup>C what is the specific heat capacity of iron?
